main_definition: To lift or elevate something, to bring up in a higher position or level; often used as an idiom with various meanings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: to cause the height of (someone) from birth
meanings_and_examples.example: He was raised by his grandparents after losing both parents at a young age.

meanings_and_examples.definition: to bring up or educate (a child)
meanings_and_examples.example: She took on the responsibility of raising her niece while her sister pursued higher education.

meanings_and_examples.definition: to lift or move to a higher position
meanings_and_examples.example: After finishing his homework, he raised the dishwasher's lid to put in the dirty plates.
The company decided to raise its prices due to increased production costs.
They worked hard to raise the quality of their products, resulting in better customer satisfaction.

meanings_and_examples.definition: to support or champion a cause
meanings_and_examples.example: The organization decided to raise awareness about environmental issues by organizing a fundraising event.
